availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth A. Haws. Father of Arthur W. Haws and John J. C. Haws. Lawrence County sheriff from at least 1850 to 1859.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 138. Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at the Session Which Was Begun and Held in the City of Frankfort, On Saturday the 31st of December, 1853, and Ended Friday the 10th of March, 1854 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, 1854), p. 257. Journal of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Begun and Held in the Town of Frankfort, On Monday, the Fifth Day of December, In the Year of Our Lord 1859, And of the Commonwealth the Sixty-Eighth (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1859), p. 88-89. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 31. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kansas, Johnson County, Monticello Township, p. 114.
